reasons_to_visit.details: May often brings pleasant, mild spring weather (avg highs ~19°C/66°F) and significantly longer daylight hours, ideal for comfortable sightseeing, boat cruises on Lake Geneva, and exploring Lausanne's diverse neighborhoods.
Experience the stunning UNESCO Lavaux vineyards in their vibrant green spring attire. Lausanne's parks (Mon Repos, Denantou, Botanical Garden) are filled with blooming flowers.
Outdoor seating at cafes and restaurants becomes widespread. Enjoy drinks or meals in the trendy Flon district, on sunny Old Town squares, or with stunning views from terraces in Ouchy.
Enjoy Lausanne with fewer tourists than in the peak summer months (July/August), offering a more relaxed experience at the Olympic Museum, Plateforme 10, and along the Ouchy waterfront.
Temperatures are generally perfect for hiking through the Lavaux vineyards, exploring trails in the nearby Jura mountains, or cycling along Lake Geneva's shores before the summer heat sets in.
Lake Geneva's boat company (CGN) typically switches to its full summer schedule in May, offering more frequent connections and routes, including to France and scenic spots like Montreux.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: May can still be unpredictable. The 'Ice Saints' ('Saints de Glace', mid-May) can bring sudden cold snaps. Rain showers and cooler days are still possible, potentially obscuring Alpine views across the lake.
May marks a noticeable increase in tourism. Expect more people at attractions like the Olympic Museum and on popular boat routes. Accommodation prices rise towards high season levels.
May 1st (Labour Day), Ascension Day (Ascension - variable), and potentially Whit Monday (Lundi de Pentecôte - variable) are public holidays with widespread shop closures in Vaud/Lausanne.
Grass pollen counts are typically high in May, which can significantly affect allergy sufferers enjoying the lakeside promenades, parks, and vineyards.

reasons_to_reconsider.reason: Lake Geneva Still Cold for Swimming
reasons_to_reconsider.details: While lakeside lounging begins, Lake Geneva's water temperature is usually still quite cold for comfortable swimming in May.

reasons_to_reconsider.reason: Higher Jura Trails Still Potentially Muddy/Snowy
reasons_to_reconsider.details: While lower vineyard trails are fine, higher altitude hiking trails in the Jura mountains may still have muddy sections or patches of snow, especially early in the month.

weather.precipitation: Mix of sunny spring days and potential rain showers. The 'Ice Saints' ('Saints de Glace', roughly May 11-15) can bring a noticeable cold snap. Lake breezes can feel cool.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, sweaters, a light to medium-weight jacket (waterproof recommended), comfortable walking shoes for steep streets. Sunscreen and sunglasses needed. Allergy medication if needed.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate and increasing. Busy around May 1st holiday and Ascension Day (if early). Shoulder season feel with noticeable visitor numbers at the Olympic Museum and Ouchy.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder/High season prices. Book popular hotels and specific cruises ahead, especially around holidays.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Vibrant spring awakening. Parks and vineyards are lush green. Outdoor dining returns noticeably. May 1st sees closures.

events_holidays.name: Labour Day (Fête du Travail)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday in Vaud. Widespread closures of shops, banks, etc. Plan activities accordingly.
events_holidays.notes: Most museums/attractions usually open (check hours). CGN boats typically run.

events_holidays.name: Spring Markets (Marchés de Printemps)
events_holidays.description: Local spring markets might appear in squares (e.g., Place de la Riponne) or specific neighborhoods, offering crafts, food, plants, and flowers.
events_holidays.notes: Check local listings (Lausanne Tourisme) for exact dates and locations.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Ascension)
events_holidays.date: Varies (Thursday, 40 days after Easter - often May)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday creating a long weekend. Shops closed. Special church services (e.g., at the Cathedral).
events_holidays.notes: Check date for the year. Increased domestic travel. Attractions, boats generally operate.

events_holidays.name: Cultural Events (Opera, Ballet, Concerts)
events_holidays.description: Check programs for Opéra de Lausanne, Béjart Ballet Lausanne, Orchestre de Chambre de Lausanne, and venues like Les Docks for performances.
events_holidays.notes: Book tickets in advance for popular shows.

unique_experiences.where: Between Lutry and St-Saphorin (accessible by train/bus)
unique_experiences.description: Walk amidst the stunningly green UNESCO World Heritage terraced vineyards overlooking Lake Geneva. May offers pleasant temperatures and vibrant foliage.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes. Bring water and sun protection. Follow marked trails. Consider the Lavaux Panoramic train or stopping for a tasting (check availability).

unique_experiences.description: Explore the world-renowned museum dedicated to the Olympic Games and enjoy the adjacent sculpture park blooming with spring flowers by the lake.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book museum tickets online. Allow 2-3 hours minimum. Good option for any weather.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a scenic cruise on the lake as summer schedules begin. Admire the lush green shoreline, the Lavaux vineyards from the water, and the Alpine backdrop.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check CGN timetable for routes (Montreux, Yvoire, Geneva) and potential paddle steamer trips. Swiss Travel Pass may offer discounts.

unique_experiences.where: Parc de Mon Repos, Parc de Milan (Botanical Garden), Parc Olympique, Parc Denantou
unique_experiences.description: Wander through Lausanne's beautiful parks enjoying spring blossoms, green lawns, and scenic viewpoints.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Mon Repos offers elegant landscaping, the Botanical Garden showcases diverse plants, Parc Olympique has sculptures, Denantou has a Thai pavilion.

weather.precipitation: Generally more stable and warmer than early May, with plenty of sunshine, but afternoon showers or thunderstorms remain possible. Pleasant for outdoor activities.
weather.general_tips: Focus on lighter clothing but keep layers (sweater/light jacket) for evenings or potential cool days. Sun protection essential. Longer daylight hours perfect for excursions.

tourism_level.crowds: High season approaching rapidly. Noticeably busy, especially on weekends and around holidays like Ascension (if late) or Whit Monday.
tourism_level.pricing: High season prices generally apply. Book popular excursions, vineyard tastings (if applicable), and accommodation well in advance.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Beautiful late spring/early summer feel. Ideal weather for combining vineyard walks, lake activities, and city exploration. Vibrant atmosphere along the Ouchy waterfront and in Flon.

events_holidays.name: Caves Ouvertes Vaudoises (Open Wine Cellars - Potential)
events_holidays.date: Check dates (often late May/early June weekend)
events_holidays.description: Winegrowers across the Vaud canton (including Lavaux) open their cellars for tastings. A special pass allows access to numerous participating wineries.
events_holidays.notes: Very popular event. Check Vaud Promotion or local tourist info for exact dates and pass details. Plan transport (often includes shuttle buses).

events_holidays.name: Whit Monday (Lundi de Pentecôte) (Potential Timing)
events_holidays.date: Varies (50 days after Easter - often late May/early June)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Widespread shop closures. Attractions, boats usually operate, but check hours.
events_holidays.notes: Check date for the year. Expect increased travel over the long weekend.

events_holidays.name: Museum Night (Nuit des Musées - Potential Timing)
events_holidays.description: Lausanne museums offer special late-night openings with unique events, workshops, and reduced entry fees.
events_holidays.notes: Check the official Nuit des Musées Lausanne-Pully website for dates and program.

unique_experiences.activity: Participate in Caves Ouvertes Vaudoises (if dates align)
unique_experiences.where: Lavaux vineyards and other Vaud wine regions
unique_experiences.description: Purchase a tasting pass and spend the weekend visiting numerous open wine cellars, sampling local Chasselas and other Vaudois wines, and meeting growers.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Plan your route using the event map/app. Utilize shuttle buses or trains. Designate a driver or use public transport. Very festive atmosphere.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the Cantonal Museum of Fine Arts (MCBA), Photo Elysée (photography), and mudac (design) in Lausanne's central arts hub.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ideal for a mixed-weather day. Check opening times and consider combined tickets if visiting multiple museums.

unique_experiences.activity: Walk or Cycle along Lake Geneva Shore
unique_experiences.where: Paths extending west from Ouchy towards Vidy/St-Sulpice or east towards Lutry
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the pleasant late spring weather with a walk or bike ride along the lake, passing parks, beaches, and enjoying views.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Bike rentals available in Lausanne. Paths are generally flat and well-maintained. Great for a relaxed afternoon.

unique_experiences.where: La Cité (Old Town) & Place de la Palud
unique_experiences.description: Explore the Gothic Cathedral, climb the tower for views, then wander down to Place de la Palud to see the animated clock and browse the market stalls (Wed & Sat mornings).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes for steep streets. Market is busiest in the morning. Check tower opening times.
unique_experiences.best_time: Wednesday or Saturday morning for market
